intro: Valeriana jaeschkei var. kaschmiriensis, commonly known as the Kashmir valerian, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while its roots are aromatic and contain volatile oils. This variety is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique habitat and chemical composition.
